==Events==
* [[285]] &ndash; [[Diocletian]] appoints [[Maximian]] as [[Caesar (title)|Caesar]], co-ruler.
* [[306]] &ndash; [[Constantine the Great|Constantine I]] is proclaimed [[Roman Empire|Roman]] emperor by his troops.
* [[315]] &ndash; The [[Arch of Constantine]] is completed near the [[Colosseum]] in [[Rome]] to commemorate Constantine I's victory over [[Maxentius]] at the [[Ponte Milvio|Milvian Bridge]]. 
* [[864]] &ndash; The [[Edict of Pistres]] of [[Charles the Bald]] orders defensive measures against the [[Viking]].
*[[1139]] &ndash; [[Battle of Ourique]]: The [[Almoravid dynasty|Almoravids]], led by [[Ali ibn Yusuf]], are defeated by Prince [[Afonso I of Portugal|Afonso Henriques]].
*[[1261]] &ndash; The city of [[Constantinople]] is recaptured by [[Empire of Nicaea|Nicaean]] forces under the command of [[Alexios Strategopoulos]], re-establishing the [[Byzantine Empire]].
*[[1278]] &ndash; The naval [[Battle of Algeciras (1278)|Battle of Algeciras]] takes place in the context of the [[Spanish Reconquista]] resulting in a victory for the [[Emirate of Granada]] and the Maranid Dynasty over the [[Kingdom of Castile]].
*[[1456]] &ndash; The [[Battle of Molinella]]: the first battle in Italy in which firearms are used extensively.
*[[1536]] &ndash; [[Sebastián de Belalcázar]] on his search of [[El Dorado]] founds the city of [[Cali|Santiago de Cali]].
*[[1538]] &ndash; The city of [[Guayaquil]] is founded by the Spanish [[Conquistador]] [[Francisco de Orellana]] and given the name Muy Noble y Muy Leal Ciudad de Santiago de Guayaquil.
*[[1547]] &ndash; [[Henry II of France]] is [[Coronation|crowned]].
*[[1554]] &ndash; [[Mary I of England|Mary I]] marries [[Philip II of Spain]] at [[Winchester Cathedral]].
*[[1567]] &ndash; Don Diego de Losada founds the city of Santiago de Leon de Caracas, modern-day [[Caracas]], the capital city of [[Venezuela]]. 
*[[1593]] &ndash; [[Henry IV of France]] publicly converts from [[Protestantism]] to [[Catholic Church|Roman Catholic]]ism.
*[[1603]] &ndash; [[James VI and I|James VI of Scotland]] is crowned [[List of English monarchs|king of England]] (James I of England), bringing the [[Kingdom of England]] and [[Kingdom of Scotland]] into [[personal union]]. [[Political union]] would [[Acts of Union 1707|occur in 1707]].
*[[1609]] &ndash; The [[England|English]] ship ''[[Sea Venture]]'', en route to [[Colony of Virginia|Virginia]], is deliberately driven ashore during a storm at [[Bermuda]] to prevent its sinking; the survivors go on to found a new colony there.
*[[1693]] &ndash; Ignacio de Maya founds the Real Santiago de las Sabinas, now known as [[Sabinas Hidalgo, Nuevo León]], [[Mexico]].
*[[1722]] &ndash; [[Father Rale's War|Dummer's War]] begins along the [[Maine]]-[[Massachusetts]] border.
*[[1755]] &ndash; [[British Empire|British]] governor [[Charles Lawrence (British Army officer)|Charles Lawrence]] and the [[Nova Scotia]] Council order the [[Expulsion of the Acadians|deportation]] of the [[Acadians]]. Thousands of Acadians are sent to the British Colonies in America, France and England. Some later move to [[Louisiana]], while others resettle in [[New Brunswick]].
*[[1759]] &ndash; French and Indian War: in [[Western New York]], British forces capture [[Fort Niagara]] from the French, who subsequently abandon [[Fort Rouillé]]. 
*[[1783]] &ndash; [[American Revolutionary War]]: The war's last action, the [[Siege of Cuddalore]], is ended by a preliminary peace agreement.
*[[1788]] &ndash; [[Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart]] completes his [[Symphony No. 40 (Mozart)|Symphony No. 40 in G minor]] (K550).
*[[1792]] &ndash; The [[Brunswick Manifesto]] is issued to the population of [[Paris]] promising vengeance if the [[France|French]] [[Members of the French Royal Families|Royal Family]] is harmed.
*[[1795]] &ndash; The first stone of the [[Pontcysyllte Aqueduct]] is laid.
*[[1797]] &ndash; [[Horatio Nelson, 1st Viscount Nelson|Horatio Nelson]] loses more than 300 men and his right arm during the failed conquest attempt of [[Tenerife]] ([[Spain]]).
*[[1799]] &ndash; At [[Abu Qir]] in [[Egypt]], [[Napoleon]] I of France [[Battle of Abukir (1799)|defeats]] 10,000 [[Ottoman Empire|Ottomans]] under Mustafa Pasha. 
*[[1814]] &ndash; [[War of 1812]]: [[Battle of Lundy's Lane]] &ndash; reinforcements arrive near [[Niagara Falls, Ontario|Niagara Falls]] for General Riall's [[United Kingdom|British]] and [[Canada|Canadian]] forces and a bloody, all-night battle with [[Jacob Brown]]'s [[United States|American]]s commences at 18.00; the Americans retreat to [[Fort Erie, Ontario|Fort Erie]].
*[[1824]] &ndash; [[Costa Rica]] annexes [[Guanacaste Province|Guanacaste]] from [[Nicaragua]].
*[[1837]] &ndash; The first commercial use of an [[electrical telegraph]] is successfully demonstrated by [[William Fothergill Cooke|William Cooke]] and [[Charles Wheatstone]] on July 25, 1837 between Euston and [[Camden Town]] in [[London]].
*[[1853]] &ndash; [[Joaquin Murrieta]], the famous [[Californio]] bandit known as "Robin Hood of El Dorado", is killed. 
*[[1861]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: The [[United States Congress]] passes the [[Crittenden-Johnson Resolution]], stating that the war is being fought to preserve the [[Union (American Civil War)|Union]] and not to end [[Slavery in the United States|slavery]].
*[[1866]] &ndash; The United States Congress passes legislation authorizing the [[Military rank|rank]] of [[General of the Army (United States)|General of the Army]]. [[Lieutenant general (United States)|Lieutenant General]] [[Ulysses S. Grant]] becomes the first to be promoted to this rank.
*[[1868]] &ndash; [[Wyoming]] becomes a [[Territories of the United States|United States territory]].
*[[1869]] &ndash; The Japanese [[daimyo]] begin returning their land holdings to the [[Emperor of Japan|emperor]] as part of the [[Meiji Restoration]] reforms. (Traditional [[Japanese calendar|Japanese Date]]: June 17, 1869).
*[[1893]] &ndash; The [[Corinth Canal]] in the [[Gulf of Corinth]], [[Greece]] is used for the first time.
*[[1894]] &ndash; The [[First Sino-Japanese War]] begins when the Japanese fire upon a Chinese warship.
*[[1898]] &ndash; After over two months of sea-based bombardment, the [[Puerto Rican Campaign|United States invasion]] of [[Puerto Rico]] begins with U.S. troops led by General [[Nelson A. Miles|Nelson Miles]] landing at harbor of [[Guánica, Puerto Rico]].
*[[1908]] &ndash; [[Ajinomoto]] is founded. [[Kikunae Ikeda]] of the [[University of Tokyo|Tokyo Imperial University]] discovers that a key ingredient in [[kombu]] soup stock is [[monosodium glutamate]] (MSG), and patents a process for manufacturing it. 
*[[1909]] &ndash; [[Louis Blériot]] makes the first flight across the [[English Channel]] in a [[Blériot XI|heavier-than-air machine]] from ([[Calais]] to [[Dover|Dover, England, United Kingdom]]) in 37 minutes.
*[[1915]] &ndash; [[Royal Flying Corps|RFC]] Captain [[Lanoe Hawker]] becomes the first British military aviator to earn the [[Victoria Cross]], for defeating three [[Luftstreitkräfte|German two-seat]] observation aircraft in one day, over the [[Western Front (World War I)|Western Front]].
*[[1917]] &ndash; Sir [[Robert Borden]] introduces the first [[Income taxes in Canada|income tax in Canada]] as a "temporary" measure (lowest bracket is 4% and highest is 25%).
*[[1920]] &ndash; [[Telecommunication]]s: the first transatlantic two-way [[radio]] broadcast takes place.
*  1920   &ndash; [[France]] captures [[Damascus]].
*[[1925]] &ndash; [[Telegraph Agency of the Soviet Union]] (TASS) is established.
*[[1934]] &ndash; The [[Nazi Germany|Nazis]] assassinate [[Austria]]n Chancellor [[Engelbert Dollfuss]] in a failed coup attempt. 
*[[1940]] &ndash; General [[Henri Guisan]] orders the [[Military of Switzerland|Swiss Army]] to resist German invasion and makes surrender illegal.
*[[1942]] &ndash; Norwegian Manifesto calls for nonviolent resistance to the [[Nazism|Nazis]].
*[[1943]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Benito Mussolini]] [[25 Luglio|is forced out of office]] by his own [[Italy|Italian]] Grand Council and is replaced by [[Pietro Badoglio]]. 
*[[1944]] &ndash; World War II: [[Operation Spring]] &ndash; one of the bloodiest days for the [[First Canadian Army]] during the war: 1,500 casualties, including 500 killed.
*[[1946]] &ndash; [[Operation Crossroads]]: an [[Nuclear weapon|atomic bomb]] is detonated underwater in the lagoon of [[Bikini Atoll]].
*  1946   &ndash; At Club 500 in [[Atlantic City, New Jersey]], [[Dean Martin]] and [[Jerry Lewis]] stage their first show as a [[comedy]] team.
*[[1952]] &ndash; The U.S. non-incorporated territory of [[Puerto Rico]] adopts a constitution.
*[[1956]] &ndash; 45 miles south of [[Nantucket|Nantucket Island]], the Italian [[ocean liner]] {{SS|Andrea Doria}} collides with the [[MS Athena|MS ''Stockholm'']] in heavy [[fog]] and sinks the next day, killing 51.
*[[1957]] &ndash; The Republic of [[Tunisia]] is proclaimed.
*[[1958]] &ndash; The [[African Regroupment Party]] (PRA) holds its first congress in [[Cotonou]].
*[[1959]] &ndash; [[SR.N1]] [[hovercraft]] crosses the [[English Channel]] from [[Calais|Calais, France]] to Dover, England in just over 2 hours.
*[[1961]] &ndash; In a speech [[John F. Kennedy]] emphasizes that any attack on [[Berlin]] is an attack on [[NATO]].
*[[1965]] &ndash; [[Bob Dylan]] goes [[Electric Dylan controversy|electric]] as he plugs in at the [[Newport Folk Festival]], signaling a major change in folk and rock music.
*[[1969]] &ndash; [[Vietnam War]]: [[President of the United States|U.S. President]] [[Richard Nixon]] declares the [[Nixon Doctrine]], stating that the United States now expects its [[Asia]]n allies to take care of their own military defense. This is the start of the "[[Vietnamization]]" of the war.
*[[1973]] &ndash; [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] ''[[Mars program|Mars 5]]'' space probe is launched.
*[[1976]] &ndash; [[Viking program]]: ''[[Viking 1]]'' takes the famous [[Cydonia (region of Mars)|Face on Mars]] photo.
*[[1978]] &ndash; [[Puerto Rico]] police assassinate two nationalists in the [[Cerro Maravilla murders]].
*  1978   &ndash; [[Louise Brown]], the world's first "[[In vitro fertilisation|test tube baby]]" is born.
*[[1979]] &ndash; Another section of the [[Sinai Peninsula]] is peacefully returned by [[Israel]] to [[Egypt]].
*[[1983]] &ndash; [[Black July]]: 37 [[Sri Lankan Tamil people|Tamil]] political prisoners at the Welikada high security prison in [[Colombo]] are [[Welikada prison massacre|massacred]] by the fellow [[Sinhalese people|Sinhalese]] prisoners.
*[[1984]] &ndash;  ''[[Salyut 7]]'' [[Astronaut|cosmonaut]] [[Svetlana Savitskaya]] becomes the first woman to perform a [[Extra-vehicular activity|space walk]].
*[[1993]] &ndash; Israel launches a massive attack against [[Lebanon]] in what the Israelis call [[Operation Accountability]], and the Lebanese call the Seven-Day War.
*  1993   &ndash; The [[Saint James Church massacre]] occurs in Kenilworth, Cape Town, South Africa.
*[[1994]] &ndash; Israel and [[Jordan]] sign the [[Israel–Jordan Treaty of Peace|Washington Declaration]], that formally ends the state of war that had existed between the nations since 1948.
*[[1995]] &ndash; A gas bottle [[1995 Paris Metro bombings|explodes]] in ''Saint Michel'' station of line B of the [[RER]] (Paris regional train network). Eight are killed and 80 wounded.
*[[1996]] &ndash; In a [[1996 Burundian coup d'état|military coup in Burundi]], [[Pierre Buyoya]] deposes [[Sylvestre Ntibantunganya]].
*[[2000]] &ndash; [[Air France Flight 4590]], a [[Concorde]] supersonic passenger jet, F-BTSC, crashes just after takeoff from [[Paris]] killing all 109 aboard and 4 on the ground.
*[[2007]] &ndash; [[Pratibha Patil]] is sworn in as [[India]]'s first female president.
*[[2010]] &ndash; [[WikiLeaks]] publishes [[Afghan War documents leak|classified documents about the War in Afghanistan]], one of the largest leaks in U.S. military history.
